online.madeofmagicandwires.tictac

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • online.madeofmagicandwires.tictac.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameAndroid

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Game.java Game class representing a data model for tic-tac-toe and methods for playing.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Joost Bremmer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Default size of a tic-tac-toe board.

      • boardSize

        public final int boardSize
        Represents the board size used for specific instances

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int boardSize)
        Constructor. Creates an instance using a board size of n^n tiles.
        Parameters:
        boardSize - the "cubic" amount of tiles created.

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructor. Creates an instance using a board size of DEFAULT_BOARD_SIZE^DEFAULT_BOARD_SIZE.
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_BOARD_SIZE

    • Method Detail

      • getMovesPlayed

        public int getMovesPlayed()
        Gets the amount moves played so far.
        Returns:
        the sum of moves played by both players
        See Also:
        movesPlayed

      • getPlayerOneTurn

        public java.lang.Boolean getPlayerOneTurn()
        Gets a boolean representing whose turn it is
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if it's currently Player One's turn; false for Player Two.

      • getGameOver

        public GameState getGameOver()
        Gets the state of the game.
        Returns:
        GameState keeping track of the current state of the game.
        See Also:
        GameState

      • getWins

        public int[] getWins()
        Gets an array representing the amount of wins by both players. First element represents the amount of rounds won by Player One. Second element represents the amount of rounds won by Player Two.
        Returns:
        int[2] the amount of wins by both players.

      • getBoard

        public TileState[][] getBoard()
        Gets a representation of the current board.
        Returns:
        a matrix containing every tile and its state
        See Also:
        TileState

      • setMovesPlayed

        public void setMovesPlayed(int movesPlayed)
        Sets the amount of moves played.
        Parameters:
        movesPlayed - positive integer representing the total amount of moves played

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(TileState[][] board)
        updates the current state of the board.
        Parameters:
        board - new TileState matrix representing the board.
        See Also:
        TileState

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver(GameState gameOver)
        Updates the current state of the game.
        Parameters:
        gameOver - GameState representing the new state of the game.
        See Also:
        GameState

      • setPlayerOneTurn

        public void setPlayerOneTurn(java.lang.Boolean playerOneTurn)
        updates whose turn it is.
        Parameters:
        playerOneTurn - Boolean keeping track whose turn it is; true for Player One, false for Player Two

      • setWins

        public void setWins(int[] wins)
        Updates the amount of wins of each player
        Parameters:
        wins - int[] containing two elements; wins[0] for amount of wins for Player One, wins[1] for amount of wins for Player Two

      • setWins

        public void setWins(int winsPlayerOne,
                    int winsPlayerTwo)
        Updates the amount of wins for each player
        Parameters:
        winsPlayerOne - amount of wins for Player One
        winsPlayerTwo - amount of wins for Player Two

      • choose

        public TileState choose(int row,
                        int col)
        Tries to claim a tile for the current player
        Parameters:
        row - row of the tile in the gameBoard matrix
        col - column of the tile in the gameBoard matrix
        Returns:
        the updated TileState of said tile, or TileState.INVALID if the move was impossible.
        See Also:
        TileState

      • checkWinconditionReached

        public GameState checkWinconditionReached(int row,
                                          int col)
        Checks if any player has reached a win condition.
        Returns:
        the current state of the game after checking win conditions
        See Also:
        GameState

      • getTile

        public TileState getTile(int row,
                         int col)
        Get the TileState of a specific tile
        Parameters:
        row - row of the tile
        col - column of the tile
        Returns:
        current TileState of the specific tile
        See Also:
        TileState

      • nextMove

        public int nextMove()
        Updates the various variables keeping track of which turn it is, signifying the next players move.
        Returns:
        the sum amount of moves played by both players.
        See Also:
        movesPlayed, Should be called BEFORE the next move is played, but AFTER win condition is checked.

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Resets the board and all state tracking variables for a new round.
        See Also:
        movesPlayed, playerOneTurn, boardSize, gameOver
